content:
Q: What is market value? How is this determined?
A: Market value is the cost of replacing the Insured Vehicle with a vehicle of the same make, model, condition and age of the vehicle at the time of the accident. This may be determined by the latest transactions sourced from newspaper advertisements, online motoring websites, surveyors and motor car dealers.
questions: How do you define market value in vehicle insurance terms?
What factors are considered to determine the market value of a vehicle?
Where can one find the data used to determine a vehicle's market value?
What sources are used to assess the market value of a vehicle after an accident?
How is the condition of a vehicle factored into its market value?
Can the age of a vehicle affect its market value?
What role do surveyors play in determining the market value of a vehicle?
How do online motoring websites contribute to the market value assessment?
Are newspaper advertisements reliable for determining vehicle market value?
What happens if there are no recent transactions available for a particular make and model?
